title: Reduce plastic use
steps: Use reusable bags, bottles, and containers.

title: Participate in coastal cleanups
steps: Join local cleanup events or organize a small group effort.

title: Dispose fishing gear responsibly
steps: Recycle lines and nets; never leave gear in the water.

title: Reduce seafood footprint
steps: Buy sustainably certified seafood (MSC/ASC) or eat less seafood.

title: Cut microfibers from laundry
steps: Use a microfiber-catching bag/filter and wash with cold, full loads.

title: Conserve water at home
steps: Fix leaks, install low-flow fixtures, and shorten showers.

title: Choose eco-friendly transport
steps: Walk, cycle, or use public transit to cut coastal air and water pollution.

title: Plant mangroves or native vegetation
steps: Support or volunteer in local habitat restoration projects.

title: Avoid single-use wet wipes
steps: Use reusable cloths; never flush wipes down the toilet.

title: Support marine conservation groups
steps: Donate, volunteer, or share campaigns that protect oceans.

title: Use phosphate-free products
steps: Select detergents and dish soaps labeled low- or no-phosphate.

title: Report wildlife in distress
steps: Call local marine rescue hotlines and follow their guidance.

title: Reduce light pollution near coasts
steps: Use shielded outdoor lights and turn off unnecessary lighting.
